oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robust manipulation of electron spin coherence in an ensemble of singly charged quantum dots
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Greilich, A.
Wiemann, M.
Hernandez, F. G. G.
Yakovlev, D. R.
Yugova, I. A.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Optics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using the recently reported mode locking effect we demonstrate a highly robust control of electron spin coherence in an ensemble of (In,Ga)As quantum dots during the single spin coherence time. The spin precession in a transverse magnetic field can be fully controlled up to 25 K by the parameters of the exciting pulsed laser protocol such as the pulse train sequence, leading to adjustable quantum beat bursts in Faraday rotation. Flipping of the electron spin precession phase was demonstrated by inverting the polarization within a pulse doublet sequence.
